summary:
Brigham Young University (BYU) is a private university in Provo, Utah, founded in 1875 by Brigham Young. It's run by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. BYU offers many academic programs and has 11 colleges. Most students are members of the LDS Church and follow an honor code that includes rules about dress, behavior, and religion.

BYU has four satellite campuses worldwide. Its sports teams, the Cougars, compete in Division I of the NCAA and joined the Big 12 Conference in 2023. Many students have lived abroad and speak multiple languages due to the church's missionary service.
title: Brigham Young University
